attributes.action: Exclude members receiving EU monies from debates and voting
attributes.background: Any member receiving monies, salary, subsidies or pensions must declare a conflict of interest and be excluded from debates/voting on any EU amendments.

rejection.details:
Both the House of Commons and House of Lords already have Codes of Conduct for their Members. Members are already required to register and declare financial interests, and to avoid conflicts of interest, so we're not sure what action you'd like to see.

You can find the Code of Conduct for the House of Commons here:

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/standards-and-financial-interests/parliamentary-commissioner-for-standards/code-of-conduct-and-rules-of-the-house/

You can find the Code of Conduct for the House of Lords here:

http://www.parliament.uk/business/lords/whos-in-the-house-of-lords/house-of-lords-members-conduct/#jump-link-0
